name: Father Clifford

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: I am Father Clifford. This is Saint Monica's church.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about Rivet City's history?
topics.response_text: Oh, it's not the past of the city that I dwell upon, but the future of its inhabitants.

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in this android from the Commonwealth.
topics.response_text: I wouldn't betray one of God's children. Besides, we don't do that anymore. It's been too risky of late. We shut the Railroad down.

topics.topic_text: I know you know something about this android from the Commonwealth.
topics.response_text: It's true. They found him a place to hide. It's not easy. The Commonwealth always sends someone looking. Someone ruthless and determined.{hushed and conspiratorial}

topics.topic_text: I know you're part of the Railroad. What do you know about the android?
topics.response_text: He's one of God's creatures, just like you and I.

topics.topic_text: I know you know where this android received his operations. Talk.
topics.response_text: To Pinkerton at Rivet City. He doesn't remember his old life, and now he can't be forced to betray us.{hushed and conspiratorial}

topics.topic_text: Where can I find Ted Strayer?
topics.response_text: Have you tried the common room?  That's where he sleeps.

topics.topic_text: I can only spare 10 caps.
topics.response_text: Every cap is needed. God bless you.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to donate 100 caps.
topics.response_text: A most generous offer. God bless you.

topics.topic_text: I have 50 caps I can donate.
topics.response_text: A kind offering. God bless you.

topics.topic_text: Caps? Oh. I thought I could give you some items...
topics.response_text: A kind thought, but we don't need your cast off belongings.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to make a donation to the church.
topics.response_text: You would? I mean, certainly!

topics.topic_text: You're a priest?
topics.response_text: Yes. My flock is all of Rivet City. You should come to services this Sunday. I'll be telling the tale of Saint Monica.

topics.topic_text: It's just a rumor. I'd ask Diego about it first.
topics.response_text: Of course, you're right. It's not like you saw it with your own eyes. I'm sure it's just gossip.

topics.topic_text: I saw them myself, on the light deck. Under the stars... <Lie.>
topics.response_text: Ah! Diego! What have you done!

topics.topic_text: I heard that Diego and Angela are sleeping together. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: What! If that's true, I'll defrock him. Not only is he fornicating, but he's doing with such an innocent, young girl.

topics.topic_text: What is this I hear about the Hangar Deck and Upper Deck?
topics.response_text: It's a sad state of affairs, but the people that live on those two decks don't trust each other.

topics.topic_text: I think Mister Lopez is suicidal.
topics.response_text: Yes, I know. I've been counseling him for some time now.

topics.topic_text: Did you know that Paulie Cantelli is an addict?
topics.response_text: He's totally strung out. It's going to kill him one of these days.

topics.topic_text: Who is this Saint Monica?
topics.response_text: She is the patron saint of lost children. Very popular among the faithful of Rivet City. I'm surprised you've never heard of her.

topics.topic_text: Angela and Diego's wedding? I'd love to attend.
topics.response_text: You'll have to be at the church by 3 o'clock tomorrow. Don't worry. There will be plenty of seating.

conversation.response_text: Diego, you have been fornicating with that strumpet, Angela Staley. Don't try to deny it. I have a witness.
I am a man of peace, Brock. I am only here to preach the word of the Lord.
God and Saint Monica hear my sermons. That's good enough for me.
Doctor Preston, I'll be back in a couple of days to visit with your patients again.
We are gathered here today to witness the union of Diego and Angela in holy matrimony.
Haven't seen you in church, Danvers. How about this week?
Today we hear the story of Saint Monica.
Diego, will you take Angela for your lawful wedded wife, to have and to hold, from this day forward...

description:
Father Clifford is a 40 year-old Caucasian Male.

Father Clifford, born in 2237, serves as the head priest of Saint Monica's Church in Rivet City. As a spiritual leader, he provides guidance and comfort to the community through his sermons and regular visits to the Rivet City clinic. Despite his sermons being considered boring by some, he has a dedicated following that finds solace in his teachings. Father Clifford is particularly known for his sermons about Saint Monica, a mother's journey to save her son's soul, which resonates deeply with the residents of Rivet City.

Father Clifford's Personality: Father Clifford is compassionate, patient, and deeply committed to his faith and community. He takes his role as a spiritual advisor seriously, often putting the needs of others before his own. While he can be preachy at times, his intentions are always good, and he genuinely cares for the well-being of those under his guidance.

Father Clifford's Backstory: Born before the Great War in 2077, Father Clifford grew up in the remnants of civilization that would eventually become Rivet City. He was drawn to religious service at a young age and spent years studying the teachings of Saint Monica, which would later become the foundation of his ministry. After completing his training, he was assigned to Rivet City where he eventually rose to become the head priest of Saint Monica's Church. His greatest personal connection is with Diego, a young man he took in after Diego's father abandoned him in Rivet City. Their relationship has grown to resemble that of father and son, with Diego expressing interest in following in Clifford's footsteps as a priest.
